League 1
Nice: Ben Arfa in the Aiglons, it's not for Vieira
In a press conference on Friday, the OGC Nice coach Patrick Vieira spoke about a possible return of Hatem Ben Arfa to the club Riviera.
01 Nov 2019, 14:40 by Florian Sermaise



4-3-3This is the basic composition of Patrick Vieira at the beginning of the season. The three rookies Alexis Claude-Maurice, Kasper Dolberg and Adam Ounas should be lined up in attack.Icon Sport



4-2-3-1Lees-Melou would be simply sacrificed if Patrick Vieira used this system. Burner would take the place of Atal on the right side of the defense, the latter occupying the left lane of the attack. Claude-Maurice would come to be behind Kasper Dolberg, in number 10.Icon Sport



5-4-1A somewhat more defensive composition. The central hinge would be composed of Sarr, H√©relle and Dante, with the young Stanley Nsoki occupying the left corridor. As for the middle and the attack, we remain on the classic.Icon Sport



3-4-3A composition a little more offensive than the previous one, all playing with the role of the side defenders, occupying more of a role of piston. A treat for Youcef Atal, with an incredible projection capacity.Icon Sport



4-4-2A training that could prove unlikely, but that does not remain the least interesting. Herelle could be sacrificed, allowing Nsoki to occupy the left lane. Ganago would accompany Dolberg on the front of the attack.Icon Sport

Nice: the 5 eleven for Patrick Vieira




While his name is circulating recently on the side of FC Nantes, Hatem Ben Arfa was closed the doors of OGC Nice by coach Patrick Vieira. Present at a press conference this Friday, before the reception of Reims tomorrow evening, the Azure Technician was invited to speak about a possible return of the left-handed past at the Aiglons during the 2015/2016 season, still without a club since his departure of Rennes this summer.




"He proved he had talent, but ..."




Patrick Vieira + 5 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

"The president spoke about the affinity he could have with Hatem Hatem is a very interesting player, who proved he had talent.But it does not fit into the project we want set up here at the OGC Nice, "said Patrick Vieira, struggling in recent times. The Rouge et Noir remain effectively in six games without a win, including a defeat in the League Cup week against Le Mans, 18th in Ligue 2 (2-3). The urgency of results and points earned is therefore felt on the Promenade des Anglais. It will be without Hatem Ben Arfa.
